question_body: What Danubian successor to Gallienus continued the military success of his predecessor by crushing the Alamanni at Lake Benacus and leading the Romans to a series of victories against the Goths?
What emperor faced a coup from the praetorian prefect Nymphidius Sabinus in the earliest days of his short reign?
What first wife of Augustus did he divorce having never consummated the marriage – even going so far as to send a not to her mother saying that she was still in “mint” condition?
Which of the emperors of the “Year of the Four Emperors” rules for the shortest time?
What name was shared by no less than four powerful women of the Severan dynasty?
What general was the de facto ruler of Rome for approximately the first ten months of Vespasian’s rule, as Vespasian was still in the East?
What name was given to the split governmental system engineered by Diocletian?
Whose mother was named Helena and was made a saint by the Church?
What Roman general and governor of Judaea was murdered in 118, possibly on the orders of the emperor Hadrian, who feared his popularity and good standing with the army?
Which of these was NOT a title won by the emperor Trajan as a result of his victories?
When the troops proclaimed Constantine I emperor after his father Constantius Chlorus’ death, what Caesar under his father was the rightful choice to succeed to the title of Augustus?
What did the Constitutio Antoniniana of Commodus in 212 do?

question_options.A: It allowed for the distribution of grain to the poor.
question_options.B: It made the Danube River the permanent eastern boundary of the Empire.
question_options.C: It claimed that Rome had rights to whatever lands they wished to have.
question_options.D: It extended citizenship to all free inhabitants of the Empire.

question_body: Successes against which Armenian king earned the Roman general Corbulo the envy and mistrust of Nero, eventually causing Nero to force him to commit suicide?
What demand did the Praetorians make of the new emperor Nerva – a demand which he acceded to?

question_options.A: They wanted to execute Domitian’s killers
question_options.B: They wanted to double their own pay
question_options.D: They wanted immunity from Roman law

question_body: Which of the claimaints to the imperial throne in 193 was proclaimed emperor by his troops in Britain and Gaul after the murder of Pertinax?
Which Praetorian, the murderer of Caligula, was one of the few to ever be punished for his crime, as he was killed with the same sword with which he stabbed Caligula?
By whom were Balbinus and the famous Pupienus hailed as emperor in 238 after Maximinus’ death?
What Roman-friendly king of Armenia did the Persian Narses drive out in 296, beginning a series of battles with Galerius and Diocletian?
Which woman married an equestrian, Rufrius Crispinus, and the future emperor Otho, before marrying the current emperor Nero in 62 AD?
At the famed Conference of Milan of 313, a long-awaited marriage took place between Constantia and whom?
Which of these events in the reign of Constantine happened LAST?
What does the emperor Vitellius’ name mean?
Which Roman emperor was the son of the ill=fated Valerian?
Who was the first man to hold the imperial throne without having been a senator?
Against what Persian “King of Kings” did Alexander Severus fight a war in Syria and Cappadocia until he handed on the title to his son Shapur I in 240?

Which enterprising general was sworn to Galba, turned traitor to support Vitellius, then turned on Vitellius and tried to get his troops to support Vespasian? He was eventually put to death for treachery (finally) by the emperor Titus?
Which of these correctly describes the familial relationship between the emperors Titus and Domitian?
What was the name of Titus’ Jewish lover, whom he was forced to send away because of public opinion?
Augustus forced Tiberius to adopt Germanicus as his own son, this displacing which natural son of Tiberius’?
What eldest son of Constantine the Great was put to death by his father on charges that appear to have been false?
At what site in Gaul did Septimius Severus defeat and kill Clodius Albinus in 197?
It is thought that the survival of the empire during the reign of the young Gordian III is in large part due to the brilliance of his father-in-law, the praetorian prefect. What was his name?
What Dacian capital city did Trajan finally occupy after a long battle in 106?
Which emperor issued the well-intentioned but disastrous Edict on Maximum Prices?
What was the name of the young Bithynian Greek boy who was the lifelong companion of Hadrian?
Leading up to the Battle of Adrianople, the Goths had asked for and been granted permission to settle in Roman territory because of the raids and pressure of what other people?
Which emperor, who liked his attendants to call him Hercules, was strangled in his bath on the last day of 192?
In what year was the Roman disaster in the Teutoberg Forest?
What 16 year old found himself Augustus after his father Valentinian I died 375?
Where was Vitellius holding command of two legions when they declared him emperor in 69 AD?
Which of these women was NOT one of the four wives of the emperor Claudius?
What son of Macrinus served as his Caesar for just over a year before being killed along with his father?
With whose death in 476 do we traditionally mark the end of the Western Roman Empire?
When Claudius invaded Britain, he actually did so at the invitation of several British chieftains who feared what man’s power?
Who was the leader of the famed Jewish revolt against Hadrian in 132?
To which province did the aged and sick Diocletian retire after his abdication?
What did Marcus Aurelius study under Cornelius Fronto?
What Illyrian commander, the military equal of the great Aurelian, was declared emperor by the army of the assassination of the transitory emperor Tacitus?
